definition: to write, to prescribe, to ordain
to bestow, to prefer, to favor
to refrain, to cease, to desist
to call, to invite, to pray
to plot, to scheme, to plan
to think, to assume, to guess
to be grateful, to give thanks
to raise, to resurrect, to send
to declare, to reveal, to proclaim
to correct, to reform, to improve, to make peace
then he assumed for her the likeness
to spread, to extend, to prolong
to strike, to befall, to bestow
to decree, to decide, to judge
to display, to present, to expose, to turn away
to resolve, to decide, to determine
to obscure, to confuse, to mix, to wear
to go out, to come out, to depart, to leave
to dwell, to live, to rest
to suffer, to be wretched, to be distressed
to defraud, to chain, to shackle
to intend, to desire, to want, to wish
surely He (would have) given them power
to pay in full, to fulfill
to hope, to expect, to desire
to be wretched, to be evil
to restrict, to control, to have power
to be good, to be kind
to count, to calculate, to enumerate
to be corrupted, to be ruined
to surround, to encompass, to envelope
to look alike, to seem alike
to grant, to bestow, to provide
to commit, to acquire, to earn
to deviate, to assult, to incline
to make a covenant, to promise
to determine, to plan, to plot, to desire
to cast, to throw, to hurl
to submit, to greet, to pay
and provides a grave for him
to fulfill, to complete, to perfect
to distance, to become remote, to keep away
to be insolent, to exceed, to rebell
to be near, to nearly do, to almost do
to give ruling, to explain, to advise
to come forth, to go out
to take charge, to nurse, to rear
surely we would have stoned you
to go on, to continue, to pass
to fall, to occur, to fulfill
to make, to construct, to do
to take way, to remove, to withdraw
to send away, to drive away
to withhold, to withdraw, to close
to specify, to ordain, to make obligatory
and would be conscious of it
are gathered to their appointed time
to set out, to depart, to judge
to eat, to taste, to feed
to light, to flash, to glow
to scatter, to blow away, to blast
to remain, to stay, to hesitate, to delay
to engage in idle talk, to converse vainly
(even as much as) a hair on a date-seed
to feel fear, to be afraid
to withdraw, to leave, to keep away
to indicate, to show, to direct
to instruct, to advise, to preach
to blind, to destory, to obliterate
to arise from sleep for prayer
to incite, to scare, to drive out
to be satisfied, to be secure, to be content
to create, to produce, to multiply
to step, to trod, to trample
to sepearte, to distinguish, to stand apart
to let go waste, to neglect
to act wickedly, to commit evil
with this silver coin of yours
to be bewildered, to be dumbfounded
to show intolerance, to be perturbed
you will be able to do justice
to hold back, to wrap up
(as much as) the membrane of a date-seed
and that which is gored by horns
and that which is hit fatally
and that which is strangled (to death)
